{{infobox biodatabase |title = PubMed |logo = |description = |scope = |organism
= |center = United States National Library of Medicine (NLM) |laboratory =
|author = |pmid = |released = January 1996 |standard = |format = |url =
|download = |webservice = |sql = |sparql = |webapp = |standalone = |license =
|versioning = |frequency = |curation = |bookmark = |version= }} 'PubMed' is a
free database accessing primarily the MEDLINE database of references and
abstracts on life sciences and biomedical topics. The United States National
Library of Medicine (NLM) at the National Institutes of Health maintains the
database as part of the Entrez information retrieval system. PubMed was first
released in January 1996.
